title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.10.23| 10-06-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chaksharunmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Srimate Bhaktivedanta Svamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gaurabhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naramchaiva Narottamam
Devim Saraswati Vyasam
Tato Jaya Mudhirayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 23rd verse of the 10th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Savaayam Yat Padam Atra Surayo Jitendriya Nirjitam Atarishvanaha
Pashyanti Bhakti Utkalitat Amalatmana
Nanvesha Sattvam Parimastum Arhati
The meaning of this verse is
Here is the same Supreme Personality of Godhead
whose transcendental form is experienced by the great devotees
who are completely cleansed of material consciousness
by dint of rigid devotional service and full control of life and the senses.
And that is the only way to purify existence.
These are words spoken by the ladies of Hastinapura.
They are discussing amongst themselves about the personality of Godhead Krishna.
This is when Krishna is about to leave Hastinapura for travelling back to Dwaraka.
So these ladies, they are not any great women.
They are not that great they are not very well educated.
See, they have absolutely no knowledge of Krishna.
They have no wisdom in Krishna and they have no knowledge of the great Godhead Krishna.
Can't they even understant or understand what Krishna is about?
They are not aware of him, they are aware of the great Godhead Krishna who is about to leave Hastinapura.
So, what is Krishna?
What is Krishna's personality?
What is the nature of Krishna?
What is Krishna's identity, what does he mean by that?
What is Krishna's personality?
And of course, that hearing also results in purification of the heart in awakening their dormant Krishna consciousness, which is natural for everyone, every living being, every person.
It is natural. So we can also adopt the same method of awakening our own Krishna consciousness.
It is with this perspective that Srimad Bhagavatam has been spoken by Shukadeva Goswami, has been recorded by Srila Vyasadeva, has been translated and commented by all the Acharyas.
And it is with this purpose only Srila Vyasadeva has been recorded.

And the same way that absolute truth, Insatana Bhagavad explains to us in very simple easily understandable language, the Srimad Bhagavatam, which is in Sanskrit language, he is giving us in simple English.
So they are describing who can actually experience the transcendental form of Krishna.
Krishna, the Supreme Absolute Truth, the Supreme Personality of Godhead,
Krishna, the Supreme Absolute Truth, the Supreme Personality of Godhead,
is the sentirable energy that accelerates death and просperity of people.
a transcendental person, is the transcendental person and that form, transcendental form
cannot be seen with ordinary eyes. Krishna is seated in our heart but we look into our heart
we cannot see Krishna in our present condition. So how can we see Krishna? That is possible if
we cleanse our material consciousness by two things mentioned here. We perform rigid devotional
service and we are able to gain full control of life and the senses. Only then we can actually
see Krishna within our own eyes.
We can see Krishna within our own heart and not only that they are telling that this method of
cleansing the heart is the only way to purify our existence, present state of existence, material
existence. The only way. So Srila Prabhupada explains in the purport that it is stated in the
Bhagavad Gita that
the Lord can be known in his real nature by dint of pure devotional service only.
Bhaktiamam abhijanati yavanyas chasmi tatvatah. Krishna says in the 18th chapter of the Bhagavad Gita
Bhaktia only by dint of pure devotional service. We can know Krishna. Bhaktiamam abhijanati. We can know him.

Yavan yas yaha chasmi tatvatah. Tatvatah means the real nature of Krishna. Not mistaking him to be a ordinary covered boy or just another king in Dwaraka or just another prince in Mathura. No. As the supreme personality of Godhead, he is the supreme personality of Godhead.
Since, him
is truly an superb person.
It is pipes need sumitra instructions.

Who are able to clear the mind of all material dust by rigid devotional service can experience the Lord as he is. Rigid devotional service. That means devotional service that is taken up as a serious practice.

In the Bhagavad Gita also the same thing is explained. By rigid devotional service. Practice. Constant practice. Every day we have to chant and hear Hare Krishna, Hare Krishna, Krishna Krishna, Hare Hare, Hare Rama, Hare Rama, Rama Rama, Hare Hare.
Every day.

Every day we have to worship Krishna. Every day we have to take food offered to Krishna as prasadam. Every day we have to sing Krishna's glories. We have to hear the Srimad Bhagavatam or read the Bhagavatam or recollect the pastimes of Krishna which we may have heard earlier.
This is required every day.
Srimad Bhagavatam sevaya. Nitya means every day. Regularly. Constantly. Always.
This way the mind can become purified of all material dust.
This material dust we have accumulated over long association with material nature in past so many millions of years.
Of lifetimes.
We have been around in this material world changing bodies again and again and again and again and again.
This is called repetition of birth and death. Samsara.
We perform some activities in this life.
And those activities result in some reactions, good or bad.
And then to

undergo those reactions we get another body and in the next life again we perform some more material activities and this repeats till we come in contact with a pure devotee of Krishna like Srila Prabhupada and after that we accept the process of rigid devotional self.

This is the service. Until then our material existence continues life after life after life after life after life. You can see everywhere around you what are people engaged in. They are simply engaged in material activities whether good or bad.
So they have no chance of purifying their body.

Mind. So they remain in ignorance. Darkness of ignorance. And only in the human form of life do we have the developed intelligence to understand this. Who am I? Who is Krishna? What is my relationship with Krishna? What am I entitled to? As spirit soul I am entitled to eternal happiness in association with Krishna.
That is explained by Srila Prabhupada.

So Srila Prabhupada explains further in this purport. Jita Indriya means one who has full control over the senses. Jita Indriya. One who has conquered his senses. Normally we are dictated by our senses. Our senses demand and we try to fulfill those demands.
With the hope that I will be able to fulfill those demands.

I will become happy if I satisfy my senses. This is ignorance actually. The reality is that these senses if they are controlled and engaged in devotional service only then can we become really happy. Experience real happiness.
If we are Jita Indriya.
Those who are simply trying to satisfy the demands of the senses they are called Ajita Indriya.
Ajita Indriya.
Most people they are just having these uncontrolled senses and their life is only simply satisfying the demands of the senses all the time.
All the time.
and the center of all these senses is the mind so it's the mind which is
driving the senses and the senses are driving our organs of action and is
simply engaged in different activities with the single aim of satisfying the
senses and the mind with a hope that we can become happy but it is explained
here that sense control is not possible by stopping all activities of the senses
and it is even explained here for Srila Prabhupada the artificial means of the
yogic processes to make the senses inactive has proved to be
abject failure trying to stop the senses by even the hatha yoga or the
ashtanga yoga process is not a guaranteed method of controlling the
senses the example is given of Vishwamitra Muni a very famous example he
controlled his senses by yogic trance but when he happened to meet Menaka an
absurd
trauma he became a victim of sex and artificial way of controlling the senses
failed what is this artificial way you try to suppress the senses we say no no
no no to demands of the senses but the devotee simply engages all the senses and
that is exactly what is bhakti rishikeshya sevannam bhakti ruchyate
engage the senses to fulfill himself
the eyes and seeing the beautiful form of Krishna, engage the tongue in tasting
wonderful Krishna Prasadam, engage the ears in hearing nice Krishna Katha or
nice Krishna Bhajans, like that and your senses automatically become controlled
and when they are purified you can see Krishna. I'll stop here. Thank you very
much. Hare Krishna.
